intro: Ouratea mazaruniensis, commonly known as the Mazaruni ouratea, is a flowering plant species native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
